byline.contributor: Jonathan Soble contributed reporting from Tokyo, Melissa Eddy from Berlin and Claire Barthelemy and Prashant S. Rao from London.

abstract: Environment Ministry of South Korea says Nissan Motor manipulated emissions of Qashqai diesel-power sport utility vehicle, and orders Japanese automaker to recall all 814 cars sold in South Korea; is also seeking criminal charges against Takehiko Kikuchi, head of car manufacturer's local operations, for violating emissions laws.
lead_paragraph: The finding, covering about 800 vehicles, was disputed by the Japanese carmaker, which said the model in question had passed European checks.

headline.main: South Korea Accuses Nissan of Cheating on Emissions Tests
headline.print_headline: South Korea Accuses  Nissan of Cheating  on Emissions Tests

snippet: The finding, covering about 800 vehicles, was disputed by the Japanese carmaker, which said the model in question had passed European checks.
